description: An introduction to the discipline of history. History viewed as an art, a science, and something in between; differences between fact, interpretation, and consensus; history as a predictor of future events. Focus on issues such as the interdependence of variables, causation and verification, the role of individuals, and to what extent historical inquiry can or should be a moral enterprise.Â Enrollment limited to first-year students. Preregistration required; see under First-Year Seminar Program.
title: What History Teaches
